intro: Moraea insolens, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a striking ornamental plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact, upright growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its unique appearance and hardiness, it is a popular choice among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant ornamental plants.
